result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius L. Levy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered. Bail on deposit, if any, to apply. Remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction  he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with firearms.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrius L. Levy in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 year with the following conditions:
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at $250.00.  If the victim is requesting more restitution, she is to contact the district attorney and ask to have the case set for another court date.

Court will not set for a probation review hearing.  If the agent needs a hearing he/she is to contact the court.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Demetrius L. Levy in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
Defendant wants to change his plea.
As to count 1:
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
Jury trial date of 08/15/2016 vacated.
Case adjourned for sentencing in branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Demetrius L. Levy in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lamia S. & Nathaniel J.

Defendant Demetrius L. Levy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Demetrius L. Levy in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
